data.title: The Completist Geek
data.text:
Official Release Date: April 24, 1970

Copyright: Walt Disney Production © 1970

Distributed by: Buena Vista Distribution Co., Inc.

MPAA Rating: G (General Audiences ~ All Ages Admitted)

Length: 79 Minutes

[table caption=”Cast and Characters” colalign=”center|right|left|center|left”] [attr sort=”false”]|Cast|Character/Performance|[attr sort=”false”]|Notes[attr sort=”false”]

|Hermione Baddeley|Madame Adelaide Bonfamille||

|Pat Buttram|Napoleon||

|Ruth Buzzi|Frou-Frou||singing

|Maurice Chevalier|‘The Aristocats’||

|Dean Clark|Berlioz||

|Scatman Crothers|Scat Cat||

|Gary Dubin|Toulouse||

|Liz English|Marie||

|Monica Evans|Abigail Gabble||

|Eva Gabor|Duchess||speaking

|Phil Harris|Abraham de Lacy Giuseppe Casey Thomas O’Malley||

|Sterling Holloway|Roquefort||

|Lord Tim Hudson|English Cat||

|Nancy Kulp|Frou-Frou||speaking

|Charles Lane|Georges Hautecourt||credited as ‘Lawyer‘

|Robie Lester|Duchess||singing

|George Lindsey|Lafayette||

|Roddy Maude-Roxby|Edgar||credited as ‘Butler‘

|Roddy Maude-Roxby|Trunk Movers||

|Thurl Ravenscroft|Russian Cat||

|Peter Renaday|French Milkman||

|Vito Scotti|Italian Cat||

|Carole Shelley|Amelia Gabble||

|Bill Thompson|Uncle Waldo||

|Paul Winchell|Chinese Cat||

[/table]

Music

Music by George Bruns

[table caption=”Songs”] Song|Composer/ Lyricist|Performers|Notes

The Aristocats|Richard M. Sherman & Robert B. Sherman|Maurice Chevalier|

Ev’rybody Wants To Be A Cat|Floyd Huddleston & Al Rinker|Scatman Crothers as Scat Cat, Liz English as Marie, Phil Harris as Thomas O’Malley, & Thurl Ravenscroft as Russian Cat|

Ev’rybody Wants To Be A Cat (Reprise)|||

Scales And Arpeggios|Richard M. Sherman & Robert B. Sherman|Dean Clark as Berlioz, Gary Dubin as Toulouse, & Liz English as Marie|

She Never Felt Alone|Richard M. Sherman & Robert B. Sherman|Robie Lester as Duchess|

Thomas O’Malley Cat|Terry Gilkyson|Phil Harris as Thomas O’Malley|

[/table]

[table caption=”Awards”] Award|Year|Winner/ Nominee|Category|Recipient|Notes

Grammy Awards|1970 (13th)|Nominee|Best Recording for Children||The AristoCats (Original Motion Picture Soundtrack)

[/table]
